PAD_BrainJarLoot.synopsis: Picking up one of the special brain jars, for Slave Mind, Dark Mind and Our Mind respectively.

PAD_DeadImps.synopsis: Player comments when seeing dead imps in the lab.

PAD_NautiloidBook.synopsis: Player picks up a mind flayer record, with some lore they pick up that telepathically flashes through their eyes. Other records already talk about humans, elves, dwarves, goblins, mindflayer history...This one could be about the nautiloid itself
PAD_NautiloidBook.how_to_trigger: Interact with tablet in TUT_Avernus_C in 3; 18; -412

PAD_IllithidEmpireBook.synopsis: Player picks up a mind flayer record, with some lore they pick up on mindflayers, could be about the Mindflayer Empire
PAD_IllithidEmpireBook.how_to_trigger: Interact with tablet in TUT_Avernus_C in 0; 18; -410

TrappedDevourer.synopsis: Players find a humanoid strapped to an operation chamber, his skull opened to reveal his brain. When starting a dialogue with the humanoid, they will hear a strange voice in their mind. Through investigation they can learn this to be an intellect devourer trapped in the man's skull. The player can assist in liberating the intellect devourer and gain it as a follower for the duration of the tutorial or kill it.
TrappedDevourer.how_to_trigger: Repro Steps:1. Start the game.2. goto 2.56, 21.84, -434.483. Talk with Myrnath

PAD_MFBook.synopsis: Player picks up a mind flayer record, with some lore they pick up that telepathically flashes through their eyes. Other records already talk about humans, elves, dwarves, goblins, mindflayer history...This one could be about mindflayer abilities or any other relevant topic.
PAD_MFBook.how_to_trigger: Interact with tablet in TUT_Avernus_C in 0; 19; -410

BrainReader.synopsis: tarted by interacting with the device. Allows player to insert certain brains in it and read part of their contents. There are currently three brains that can be read. That of a Shar cleric that will reveal a hint on the acquisition of the box. A brain of an adventurer that reveals the location of a secret in WLD or SCL. And the brain of a mindflayer that has a tbd secret.

AD_DevourerVictim.synopsis: The Intellect Devourer asking for help from a distance, as the player approaches, while it is still trapped in the skull.

PAD_AcidMawComment.synopsis: Player interacts with a foreign object that seems to have a type of liquid in it.

PAD_GoblinBook.synopsis: Played on clicking on an indecipherable illithid record.

PAD_HistoryBook.synopsis: Player picks up a mind flayer record, which they cannot make out.

DevourerFollower.synopsis: Default dialogue for the trapped intellect devourer when freed. It is tapped into the hivemind of mindflayers. It believes us to be like it. Depending on whether we crippled it previously, it might believe us ot be its director, or its friend.

PAD_ClosedBrinepool.synopsis: A oneliner PAD for when players interact with a closed brinepool, which looks like a shell. It is clearly similar to the one in the starting room, but that one was open due to the impact of the dragon fire.
PAD_ClosedBrinepool.how_to_trigger: Interact with closed brinepool in TUT_Avernus_C -15; 17; -422

PAD_SocietyBook.synopsis: Player picks up a mind flayer record, which they cannot make out.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Among the sessions, the only clear narrative chain is the one involving the intellect devourer. First, while the player is approaching the devourer, they trigger AD_DevourerVictim where the trapped intellect devourer calls for help from a distance. This is then followed by the main dialogue in TrappedDevourer where the player interacts with the humanoid and, through investigation, learns about the intellect devourer trapped inside. Finally, if the player decides to help and free the devourer (as opposed to killing it), they will trigger DevourerFollower – the session where the freed intellect devourer becomes a follower. This means that AD_DevourerVictim must come before TrappedDevourer, and TrappedDevourer must come before DevourerFollower. Moreover, while the killing outcome is mentioned in the description of TrappedDevourer, it is mutually exclusive with the branch that leads to DevourerFollower (i.e. if the player cripples or kills the devourer, they never get the follower dialogue). None of the other sessions (such as the various PAD book pickups or environmental commentaries) show an explicit cause‐and‐effect relation or conflict with other sessions, so no ordering or exclusivity constraints can be deduced for them.

PAD_DeadImps_0.speaker: Player
PAD_DeadImps_0.text: Devilkin. Am I in the Hells?
PAD_DeadImps_0.context: NodeContext: lae'zel's line: gh'ath = ship. gah-ATH

PAD_NautiloidBook_0.speaker: Narrator
PAD_NautiloidBook_0.text: *A schematic of a nautiloid flashes into your mind. Nerves, sinews, as much living being as ship.*

PAD_IllithidEmpireBook_0.speaker: Narrator
PAD_IllithidEmpireBook_0.text: *Worlds beyond worlds flash before your eyes, empires of a grand design, traversed by ships just like this.*

TrappedDevourer_3.speaker: Psionic Presence
TrappedDevourer_3.text: Don't leave us, please don't. Please don't leave us.

TrappedDevourer_10.speaker: Myrnath
TrappedDevourer_10.context: NodeContext: Death gasp of a man whose brain has just become an intellect devourer and run away.

TrappedDevourer_65.speaker: Psionic Presence
TrappedDevourer_65.text: Yes! You've come to save us from this place, from this place you'll free us!
TrappedDevourer_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: A man is strapped to a chair, his skull cracked open, brain exposed to the elements. A voice fills the players' head - it is disjointed, genderless, neither whispered nor shouted.InternalNodeContext: MARKETING PATH

TrappedDevourer_52.speaker: Narrator
TrappedDevourer_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brain quiversInternalNodeContext: MARKETING PATH

TrappedDevourer_105.speaker: Psionic Presence
TrappedDevourer_105.text: Please, before they return. They return.

TrappedDevourer_13.speaker: Player
TrappedDevourer_13.text: Who am I talking to - a man or a brain?

TrappedDevourer_104.speaker: Psionic Presence
TrappedDevourer_104.text: A newborn. Born new from this husk.

TrappedDevourer_2.speaker: Narrator
TrappedDevourer_2.text: *You realise you're talking to an intellect devourer, a minion of the mind flayers who abducted you.*

TrappedDevourer_23.speaker: Narrator
TrappedDevourer_23.text: *You know no creature like this - one that is more brain than person.*

TrappedDevourer_48.speaker: Player
TrappedDevourer_48.text: What do you want from me, exactly?

TrappedDevourer_61.speaker: Psionic Presence
TrappedDevourer_61.text: Remove us from this body - from this case free us. Please!

TrappedDevourer_54.speaker: Narrator
TrappedDevourer_54.text: *You notice oedema - a swelling of the brain causing pressure where it strains against the shell of the skull.*

TrappedDevourer_41.speaker: Player
TrappedDevourer_41.context: InternalNodeContext: Added the 'TalkedToIntellectDevourer' check here to exclude Duergar and Gith that have already recognised that it's an intellect devourer [SR]

TrappedDevourer_85.speaker: Narrator
TrappedDevourer_85.text: *With a start, you realise you're talking to an intellect devourer, a minion of the mind flayers who abducted you.*

TrappedDevourer_86.speaker: Narrator
TrappedDevourer_86.text: *You realise you are talking to a brain rather than a person - but you know no creature like this.*

TrappedDevourer_56.speaker: Narrator
TrappedDevourer_56.text: *Apart from this strange context, you notice nothing unusual about the brain.*

TrappedDevourer_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player hits the side of the skull trying break a piece of bone loose to free the brain.

TrappedDevourer_103.speaker: Player
TrappedDevourer_103.text: Gently prise the brain from the skull.

TrappedDevourer_59.speaker: Narrator
TrappedDevourer_59.text: *The brain lifts from the skull, but you notice an opportunity - you could cripple the strange creature, making it more subservient should it prove a threat.*
TrappedDevourer_59.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player gingerly pries the brain from the skullInternalNodeContext: MARKETING PATH

TrappedDevourer_40.speaker: Narrator
TrappedDevourer_40.text: *Your fingers twitch with the desire to rip its tender, moist meat to shreds.*

TrappedDevourer_99.speaker: Player
TrappedDevourer_99.text: Imagine a brain full of holes. A brain like your own.

TrappedDevourer_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Open to interpretatoin) The player digs a finger into the side of the brain, pressing on something inside it).

TrappedDevourer_75.speaker: Narrator
TrappedDevourer_75.text: *The creature seems unaware of your interference. It relaxes in your hands.*
TrappedDevourer_75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player continues lifting hte brain from the skull and sets the intellect devourer on the ground.InternalNodeContext: MARKETING PATH

TrappedDevourer_94.speaker: Us
TrappedDevourer_94.text: We are free. Our freedom is ours. Friend.

TrappedDevourer_25.speaker: Narrator
TrappedDevourer_25.text: *The creature pauses, listening. Something behind your eye seizes in recognition.*
TrappedDevourer_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot focused on the brain, which should be tensed. Player might wince.InternalNodeContext: MARKETING PATH

TrappedDevourer_7.speaker: Us
TrappedDevourer_7.text: We must go to the helm. At the helm we are needed.

TrappedDevourer_69.speaker: Us
TrappedDevourer_69.text: To the helm we go. We are going to the helm.

TrappedDevourer_64.speaker: Narrator
TrappedDevourer_64.text: *The brain tenses, as though querying an unseen advisor.*

TrappedDevourer_18.speaker: Us
TrappedDevourer_18.text: Do you not hear it? We will not survive here. We are needed to navigate - we are needed to leave this realm.

TrappedDevourer_16.speaker: Player
TrappedDevourer_16.text: I helped you once, but that's all I can do.

TrappedDevourer_73.speaker: Us
TrappedDevourer_73.text: Do nothing for me. Do everything for us.

TrappedDevourer_55.speaker: Player
TrappedDevourer_55.text: I'll go - but not with you.

TrappedDevourer_46.speaker: Player
TrappedDevourer_46.text: No. You have to stay here.

TrappedDevourer_109.speaker: Us
TrappedDevourer_109.text: We listen to our friend. Our friend who saved us.

TrappedDevourer_37.speaker: Us
TrappedDevourer_37.text: No! We are us! We must survive!

TrappedDevourer_45.speaker: Us
TrappedDevourer_45.text: Us. Together. We must leave this place. We must be safe.

TrappedDevourer_38.speaker: Us
TrappedDevourer_38.text: We must go to the helm. We must navigate the ship. We must leave this place.

TrappedDevourer_62.speaker: Psionic Presence
TrappedDevourer_62.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~[Reuse: SN: SCENE_TUT_Lab_TrappedDevourer_Drop_Brain_Player] Combat next.NodeContext: Psionic screech

TrappedDevourer_81.speaker: Player
TrappedDevourer_81.text: Spare the creature - any injuries might weaken it.

TrappedDevourer_112.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player reaches their hands into the victim's head and tries to wrench the brain free, but it won't budge

TrappedDevourer_20.speaker: Player
TrappedDevourer_20.text: Attempt a cerebral extraction, staying mindful of the swelling.

TrappedDevourer_77.speaker: Narrator
TrappedDevourer_77.text: *The swelling is too great. You cannot lift the brain out of the skull.*

TrappedDevourer_95.speaker: Psionic Presence
TrappedDevourer_95.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player jams their fingers into the grey matter and minces the strange creature in it's cranial crib

TrappedDevourer_60.speaker: Player
TrappedDevourer_60.text: Kill the mind flayer slave before the corruption spreads.

PAD_MFBook_0.speaker: Narrator
PAD_MFBook_0.text: *A feeling penetrates your mind. An anomaly. One like ourselves, unconnected from the whole. Caution.*

BrainReader_20.speaker: Player
BrainReader_20.text: |Start of mindflayer memory. Initially is too alien to understand.|

BrainReader_28.speaker: Narrator
BrainReader_28.text: |Your head starts to hurt from trying to understand something as alien as this.|

BrainReader_24.speaker: Player
BrainReader_24.text: |There is no brain in the machine|

BrainReader_27.speaker: Narrator
BrainReader_27.text: |Inserted the adventurer brain into the machine.|

BrainReader_0.speaker: Narrator
BrainReader_0.text: |Removed the adventurer brain from the machine.|

BrainReader_23.speaker: Narrator
BrainReader_23.text: |Inserted the cleric brain into the machine.|

BrainReader_14.speaker: Narrator
BrainReader_14.text: |Removed the cleric brain from the machine.|

BrainReader_15.speaker: Narrator
BrainReader_15.text: |Inserted the mindflayer brain into the machine.|

BrainReader_11.speaker: Narrator
BrainReader_11.text: |Removed the mindflayer brain from the machine.|

PAD_AcidMawComment_1.speaker: Player
PAD_AcidMawComment_1.text: Brine. That's what they use for those... those parasites.

PAD_GoblinBook_0.speaker: Narrator
PAD_GoblinBook_0.text: *Images of goblins - their habits and histories - flash into your mind.*

PAD_HistoryBook_0.speaker: Narrator
PAD_HistoryBook_0.text: *Faint images appear in your mind: a brain, a githyanki warrior, and centuries of darkness...*

DevourerFollower_0.speaker: Us
DevourerFollower_0.text: Friend. We are going to the helm.

DevourerFollower_21.speaker: Narrator
DevourerFollower_21.text: *The creature reaches into your mind, its thoughts rattling against yours. Something inside you squirms in recognition.*

DevourerFollower_14.speaker: Us
DevourerFollower_14.text: Friend. We will go to the helm now.

DevourerFollower_10.speaker: Us
DevourerFollower_10.text: We are going to the helm! My friend wants us to go to the helm!

DevourerFollower_4.speaker: Player
DevourerFollower_4.text: I want you to stay behind.

DevourerFollower_3.speaker: Player
DevourerFollower_3.text: No - I'm going alone. You stay here.

DevourerFollower_18.speaker: Player
DevourerFollower_18.text: Why was I forced onto this ship?

DevourerFollower_15.speaker: Us
DevourerFollower_15.text: To know you. To love you. To give you our gift.

DevourerFollower_13.speaker: Player
DevourerFollower_13.text: Something was put in my eye. What was it?

DevourerFollower_20.speaker: Us
DevourerFollower_20.text: A gift. A gift to make you as we are. Soon you will be so beautiful. So powerful.

DevourerFollower_11.speaker: Player
DevourerFollower_11.text: Can you tell me where we are?

DevourerFollower_12.speaker: Us
DevourerFollower_12.text: In a realm, where we have fled. We have fled to a realm called Avernus. First of the Nine Hells. We are escaping a great evil.

DevourerFollower_17.speaker: Us
DevourerFollower_17.text: We are going to the helm. My friend and I are going to the helm.

PAD_ClosedBrinepool_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ClosedBrinepool_0.text: Filled with brine - and a whole lot of those parasites.
PAD_ClosedBrinepool_0.context: NodeContext: Said with a mixture of disgust and curiosity

PAD_ClosedBrinepool_1.speaker: Player
PAD_ClosedBrinepool_1.text: One brine pool, countless parasites. Disgusting things.
PAD_ClosedBrinepool_1.context: NodeContext: Said with a mixture of disgust and curiosity

PAD_SocietyBook_0.speaker: Narrator
PAD_SocietyBook_0.text: *A thousand years of humanoid history - elves, dwarves, humans and more - flash behind your eyes.*
